summary: A series of internal Bureau of Prisons emails from July 2019 concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein's psychological state, suicide risk assessments, medical complaints, and housing at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The emails document staff concerns about his mental health following court appearances, his placement on psychological observation, and his eventual removal from such status.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual who is the subject of all email communications. Staff document his psychological state, suicide risk factors, medical complaints, and housing requests.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: The Chief Psychologist at MCC New York who authors and receives emails regarding Epstein's psychological status, suicide risk assessments, and competency evaluation.

persons.name: Dr. Central Office
persons.context: A psychologist from the BOP Central Office consulted regarding Epstein's suicide risk factors, leading to the recommendation for a suicide risk assessment.

persons.name: Chong
persons.context: A staff member who communicated about the quantity of medication (Colace and milk of magnesia) provided to Epstein.

persons.name: Nurse
persons.context: A nurse who assessed Epstein's complaints about numbness in his right arm and neck.

connections.description: The Chief Psychologist is responsible for assessing Epstein's psychological state, ordering observations, and conducting competency evaluations.
Dr. consulted with Dr. Central Office regarding Epstein's suicide risk assessment protocol.
M forwards a message to Dr. regarding the need to notify psychology about Epstein's return from court.

events.title: Court Proceeding and Suicide Risk Alert
events.description: Epstein is expected to receive bad news in court. BOP Central Office recommends a suicide risk assessment upon his return due to his high-profile case, sex offense charges, and pre-trial status.

events.title: Epstein Observed Distraught
events.description: A staff member observes inmate Epstein as distraught, sad, confused, dazed, and withdrawn during the 10:00 PM count, prompting a request for psychology to speak with him.

events.title: Report of Neck Injury and Numbness
events.description: Epstein complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, and mentions an unspecified prior injury to his neck. He is seen by a nurse.

events.title: CPAP Machine and SHU Return Negotiation
events.description: Epstein, citing sleep apnea and impaired memory, requests to stay in a 'safe' area to use his CPAP machine. Psychologist informs him he will return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) the next day.

events.title: Removal from Psychological Observation
events.description: Dr. removes Epstein from psychological observation status and finds him competent at that time, while Epstein voices complaints about confinement conditions.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 8, 2019, BOP staff were proactively instructed to conduct a suicide risk assessment for Jeffrey Epstein upon his return from court, where he was expected to receive 'bad news'.
Epstein was placed on 'psychological observation' status due to identified risk factors including his high-profile case, sex offense charges, and pre-trial status.
Epstein complained of physical issues including numbness in his arm and neck, sleep apnea, and dehydration while in custody.
Staff documented observing Epstein as 'distraught, sad and a little confused' on July 6, 2019.
Epstein was removed from psychological observation and found competent by the Chief Psychologist on July 30, 2019.
